meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling an ampulla.
meanings.sent1: The ampullar shape of the vase made it look elegant.
meanings.sent2: The artist used ampullar curves in the design to create a sense of flow.
meanings.sent3: The ampullar clouds in the sky seemed to be dancing playfully.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had an ampullar quality, filling the room with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted an ampullar picture across the horizon.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an ampulla.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the ampullar function of the organ.
meanings.sent2: The ampullar structure was crucial for the fluid's movement.
meanings.sent3: The ampullar connection between the two systems was fascinating.
meanings.sent4: His words had an ampullar effect on her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The ampullar design of the building was both functional and beautiful.

meanings.sent1: The ampullar nature of the substance was essential for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the ampullar properties of the liquid.
meanings.sent3: The ampullar details of the map helped them navigate the terrain.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had an ampullar flair that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The ampullar scent of the flowers filled the room with a sweet fragrance.
